leeds (package)¶

Leeds core model, built upon work by Gubbins et al. (2003, 2004), Davies (2015), Davies and Pommier (2018), Greenwood et al. (2021), Greenwood et al. (2022).

Subpackages¶

  • routines (package)
    • Submodules
    • profiles (module)
    • chemistry (module)
    • energy (module)
    • snow (module)

Submodules¶

main (module)¶

thermal_history.core_models.leeds.main.evolve(model)[source]¶

Main evolution fuction for development method. Calculates rates of change for all aspects of core evolution.

Parameters

model (ThermalModel Class) – Main model

Raises

  • ValueError – If model.mantle.Q_cmb is not set either by a mantle method or manually by the user.

  • ValueError – if the cooling rate, dT_dt, is NaN, a common symptom of division by zero in one of the energy terms.

thermal_history.core_models.leeds.main.progress(model)[source]¶

Return text for this class when progress at each iteration is printed to STDOUT

Returns

String of text to be printed to screen.

Return type

String

thermal_history.core_models.leeds.main.set_Q_rs(model)[source]¶

Sets the heat flow at the top of the convecting region (rs)

Parameters

model (ThermalModel Class) – Main model

Returns

The heat flow at rs

Return type

Float

thermal_history.core_models.leeds.main.setup(model)[source]¶

Sets initial conditions from the input parameters and performs any other housekeeping (e.g. ensuring correct temperature for a given ri)

Parameters

model (ThermalModel Class) – Main model

thermal_history.core_models.leeds.main.snow_evolution(model)[source]¶

Sub-evolution fuction specifically for an iron snow-zone based on Davies and Pommier (2018). Called from evolution() if required (prm.iron_snow=True)

Parameters

model (ThermalModel Class) – Main model

Returns

Dictionary containing relevant energies/entropies/other variables to be passed back to the main evolution function.

Return type

Dict

Updates parameters based on rates of change calculatied in main fuction.

Parameters

model (ThermalModel Class) – Main model
